subject: Re: Any insight on my life changing EVP experience?
author: chuck255
full_text:
Thank you for the response 

I dont think I will ever record anything again to be honest with you 
and for the most part I havent heard much of anything since I found 
out what the real cause of things were.

Too late on that, but thank you. :) We both had issues. For the most 
part you are right about mine and I won't get into hers. I openly 
admit I have trust issues but the control ones only came into play 
here when I felt that I couldnt control or stop what was going on at 
my place even after I questioned them and got nothing.





--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, black bear hollow 
<blackbearhollow@...> wrote:
>
> I'll add that sometimes, those who record evp, get clairaudience. 
This  
> happened to me. What has happened to you is that you've sensitized  
> yourself to the voices. It will take 2-6 weeks for the effects to  
> lessen, but it's VERY important for your own mental health to not  
> record anymore ever or at least for a long time.
> 
> The reality is that you've linked up with some negative energies 
that  
> are probably really enjoying you running around and doing 
everything  
> they tell you. They're full of poo. There is no mob and they can't  
> harm you or your family unless you allow it.
> 
> It sounds like the insanity of the horribly unhealthy relationship  
> with B might have attracted them, but who knows.
> 
> For now, it would be best for you to walk away from recording  
> altogether, and get some professional help for those crazy trust 
and  
> control issues in the near future BEFORE you get involved in any  
> relationship again.
> 
> You may hear the energies in fans, water, etc... for a few weeks 
as  
> they'll be pretty disappointed you've disappeared. Ignore them at 
all  
> costs, and eventually this phenomenon will dissipate. Be patient.
> 
> w
> On Dec 3, 2008, at 2:46 PM, chuck255 wrote:
> 
> > I am new to this
> > stuff and will just stay away from it now, but some kind of 
insight
> > would be great.
>
